bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 167, Number 133 (Thursday, July 29, 2021)][House]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Ms. WATERS:H.R. 4791.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article I, Section 8, cl. 1, To pay debts and provide forthe common Defense and General Welfare of the United States.Article I, Section 8 cl. 3, To regulate Commerce withForeign Nations, Among the Several States, and with theIndian Tribes.Article I, Section 8, cl. 18, To make all laws which shallbe necessary and proper for carrying into Execution thepowers enumerated under section 8 and all other Powers vestedby the Constitution in the Government of the United States,or in any Department or Officer thereof.[Page H4293]

item.title: A bill to extend the moratorium on residential evictions, and for other purposes.

latestAction.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Health, Education, Labor, and Pensions.

item.text: Mr. Hoyer asked unanimous consent that the Committee on Energy and Commerce be discharged from further consideration of H.R. 4791 and offered an amendment to the bill. Objection heard. (text: CR H4302)
Referred to the Subcommittee on Health.
Referred to the House Committee on Energy and Commerce.

item.fullName: Del. San Nicolas, Michael F. Q. [D-GU-At Large]

item.name: Emergency medical services and trauma care

summary.text:
Protecting Renters from Evictions Act of 2021

This bill extends through December 31, 2021, the order issued by the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention titled Temporary Halt in Residential Evictions To Prevent the Further Spread of COVID–19 and published on September 4, 2020.

bill.title: Protecting Renters from Evictions Act of 2021

item.title: To extend the moratorium on residential evictions, and for other purposes.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
